description: {"blocks":[{"key":"3bv7o","text":"This procedure provides instructions for how to perform qualitative PCR (qPCR) for the detection of the hIS1001 insertion sequence of Bordetella holmesii and the bfrZ gene of Bordetella bronchiseptica from appropriate direct specimens. This test is intended to be used as a secondary assay to differentiate B. pertussis (IS481 positive) from B. holmesii. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":134,"length":20},{"style":"italic","offset":175,"length":25},{"style":"italic","offset":307,"length":12},{"style":"italic","offset":342,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"8sk78","text":"Perform all manipulations of samples and DNA in a genomic level PCR laboratory. Prepare all PCR master mixes in a Reagent Preparation Clean Room. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Procedure B: Setting up the Real-Time PCR Reactions

steps.section: Procedure B: Setting up the Real-Time PCR Reactions

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"eipqv","text":"Apply an optical adhesive film to the plate using a plate seal applicator, taking care to seal the plate edges and avoid touching the top of the film. steps.section: Procedure B: Setting up the Real-Time PCR Reactions

steps.section: Procedure B: Setting up the Real-Time PCR Reactions

","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d7upd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5lvo0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Procedure C: 7500 FAST Run Analysis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bea3b","text":"To view all samples, click on the small square at the top left of the plate map to select all the wells on the plate at once. Curves should appear on the graph. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Procedure C: 7500 FAST Run Analysis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"34r5p","text":"Under Options (at the bottom of the screen), select \"hIS1001\" (B. holmesii)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":63,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Procedure C: 7500 FAST Run Analysis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3la2c","text":"Unclick \"Auto Threshold\" and enter a manual value of 0.1 in the box. Click Auto Baseline.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":53,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Procedure C: 7500 FAST Run Analysis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8b5s7","text":"Repeat steps 25 and 26 but for the target \"bfrZ\" (B. bronchiseptica)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":50,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Procedure C: 7500 FAST Run Analysis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"46dl4","text":"Click on the \"Analyze\" button. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Procedure C: 7500 FAST Run Analysis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"c6ekq","text":"Ensure that under \"Plot Settings\" the \"Delta Rn vs. Cycle\" option is selected and plot colour is set to \"target\". ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Procedure C: 7500 FAST Run Analysis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"43pb2","text":"View the results of all run controls and ensure they have produced acceptable values before proceeding with clinical sample analysis. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"2i8fa","text":"Method Limitations:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7jekp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dpo9e","text":"1. Coinfections of B. pertussis with B. holmesii will be called B. holmesii positive with the use of this assay in combination with the IS481 assay. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":19,"length":13},{"style":"italic","offset":36,"length":13},{"style":"italic","offset":64,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bsqu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9idd1","text":"2. High Ct IS481 positive and negative for hIS1001 may be false negative for B. holmesii.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":77,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
